admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund:
TF026037-TA CTF FOR KAZAKHSTAN ENVIRONMENT,TF040099-CENTRAL ASIA - WATER
            ENGINEERING.  PREPARATION AND SUPERVISION OF PROJE,TF020889-SOCIAL SCIENTISTS NETWORK IN
            CENTRAL ASIA,TF025239-PHRD-ARAL SEA COMMUNITY
            REHABILITATION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated as satisfactory
            with sustainability likely. Overall Bank performance is
            rated as satisfactory. Overall Borrower performance is
            considered as fully satisfactory. The main lessons are the
            following: Benefits from piloting done over a relatively
            long implementation period, with the objective of gaining
            experience in operational methodologies, may be marginal,
            particularly where Bank supervision and support by project
            management are adequate. Where a pilot is to be implemented
            as a first phase, it is important to focus it on activities
            that would be indispensable under a variety of future
            conditions. the feasibility study for the full scale project
            brought out many issues respecting economic feasibility of
            the ASWSS, the water supply and health situation in rural
            areas, and the state of Syr Darya River, that had
            significant implications for project design. Implementation
            of investments under the pilot, without sufficient
            consideration of financial issues such as cost recovery, and
            associated institutional issues, can affect the
            sustainability of the invesments. Where project components
            or designs are to be based on existing masterplans or
            studies, especially where there is a significant time lag,
            it is important to allow for the possibility of significant
            modifications to the designs, in view of changing
            conditions. This would require appropriate increases in
            terms of both time required and cost estimates.
